title: 'Donors choose - like' application
description: It is difficult to donate in charitable institutions because of transparency issues, corruption and traceability.

f6_assessments.q0:
There are people out there that want to help.
If this is correctly implemented it could benefit a lot of people in need and cause more people to use Cardano. You would have to find a way to identify fake profiles though. This is another project that would benefit from becoming a DAO.
f6_assessments.q1: More info and evidence of experience required to gain trust. The overall plan for this proposal will improve when more committed team members join and start contributing. You need all the key players for a proposal like this, so that they can identify the potential obstacles and solutions to make this project grow into fruition. Having a committed team and solid plan will increase the voters and CAs trust and your chance of getting funded.
f6_assessments.q2:
Needs the right team to come up with the right strategy to make this proposal's success and plan clear. Challenges and risks can only be properly identified and addressed when you have a committed team. The same goes for working out an effective roadmap with key performance indicators.
Don't give up on this proposal. If it is something you really believe in I suggest you keep looking for key members to join you or look for similar proposals and ask to join their teams.

f6_assessments.q0: The idea itself is very good, in fact, I've seen several proposals saying that some of the difficulties in making a donation to NGOs / charities is the lack of transparency, bureaucracy and so on. With this problem, it would be useful to have a platform in which institutions could make a kind of document detailing what their needs would be, and donors choose or not to help. However, the problem here is that it is not said at all because that would be a dapp. Where would blockchain, ada, etc. come in? Are these donations made through ada, or a conventional currency? Do transactions result in blockchain, made through smart contracts? A relationship between the proposal and the technologies of the Cardano ecosystem remained to be drawn.
f6_assessments.q1: Unfortunately, almost nothing is said about the author of the proposal. All we know is that he's already maintained a few sites, but he doesn't know much about programming. It would be important to know who he is, his name, his professional background, what his work trajectory to date, what sites he has created, where are they? It would also be essential for the author to demonstrate the intention of forming a team, because it would be necessary, in addition to programming people, a UI/UX designer, someone from advertising to make this idea known to the people, someone who understood blockchain and everything about the Cardano universe and also someone to keep in touch with the charities. If such information were provided, we could have a notion of team, because currently practically nothing is known, unfortunately.
f6_assessments.q2: So, as in the previous comment, basically nothing is said about the project's auditability. I will suggest a roadmap: 1) start the development of the platform (dapp or website), as well as define which institutions would be covered here. 2) clarify where and how cardan ecosystem technologies would enter the project. 3) establish the target audience for advertising and launch advertising in a way that reaches and moves ada holders and people who could donate. 4) establish success metrics so that the community could track the development of the proposal. It would also be important, first and foremost, to set dates and explain how the USD 2000 would be used to carry out the project. If such information were made available, we would certainly have an auditability to analyze, because at the moment there is none, unfortunately.
